identificationModule.briefTitle: Prevalence of Monoclonal Gammopathy of Undetermined Significance (MGUS) Among Unique Populations of Black People
identificationModule.officialTitle: Prevalence of MGUS Among Unique Populations of Black People

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is being done to screen for monoclonal gammopathies in people of East African descent. Monoclonal gammopathy is a condition where abnormal proteins are found in the blood, most commonly called monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance or MGUS. There is little information on the presence of this condition in people of East African descent. This study is being done to determine how this condition affects this population in order to better treat and/or prevent this condition in the future.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:

I. To determine the prevalence of MGUS in people of East African descent in Minnesota.

OUTLINE: This is an observational study.

Participants undergo medical chart review and blood sample collection, as well as complete a questionnaire on study. Participants who test positive for MGUS are notified, along with their primary care physician, so that the necessary follow up and referral is provided as clinically indicated.

armGroups.label: Observational
armGroups.description: Participants undergo medical chart review and blood sample collection, as well as complete a questionnaire on study. Participants who test positive for MGUS are notified, along with their primary care physician, so that the necessary follow up and referral is provided as clinically indicated.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Prevalence of MGUS in people of east African descent
primaryOutcomes.description: Screening for MGUS using mass spectrometry to detect monoclonal proteins among people of east African descent in Minnesota.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* \* Adults â‰¥ 40 years without a diagnosis of multiple myeloma

  * Self-reported east African ancestry (including individuals of mixed east African descent)
  * Willing and able to review, understand, and provide consent before starting any study-specific procedures
  * Ability to complete questionnaire(s) by themselves or with assistance

Exclusion Criteria:

* \* Known diagnosis of multiple myeloma

  * Pregnant women
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Adults who self-report east African ancestry without a diagnosis of multiple myeloma
